actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that expenditures for any fiscal year shall not exceed receipts for the fiscal year.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits fiscal year expenditures from exceeding receipts, unless the Congress approves a specific excess by three-fifths rollcall vote in each House. Authorizes the Congress to waive such prohibition when a declaration of war is in effect.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that expenditures for any fiscal year shall not exceed receipts for the fiscal year.
